thread.title: Royals fans band together to support one of their own
thread.title_full: Royals fans band together to support one of their own - KCTV5

author: Chris Oberholtz, Multimedia Producer
title: Royals fans band together to support one of their own
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - Royals fans are banding together to support one of their own.
Joyce Jeter was born with neurofibromatosis, a painful genetic disorder that causes tumors to grown on her skin.
The disease causes tumors throughout the nervous system and has affected Jeter on her face, neck and spine among other places and has also caused her to lose her left leg.
The debilitating and painful disease has caused the Independence woman many hardships but has not affected her beautiful love for life and of course, the Kansas City Royals. 
"People just don't understand that it's a very hard thing for people to cope with,"Jeter said. "I have people all the time saying, take your mask off- and what's wrong with you."
Recently, hurtful comments about Jeter surfaced online after she posted a picture of her royal blue hair before Game 4 of the American League Division Series.
So a group of Royals fans acted quickly to start a GoFundMe page to send Jeter to Kauffman Stadium.
"Ever since the ballpark was at 18th and Brooklyn, I've been crazy about them," Jeter said. "I’d be in seventh heaven. I really would."
Since her condition prevents her from working, she manages to live on less than $700 a month and can’t afford to watch the games, let alone attend. However, this hasn’t stopped her from keeping up with the team and enjoying the possible ride to the World Series.
If you would like to help Jeter get season tickets for next year or possible 2015 World Series tickets, click here  to donate.
